description: In 2022, schools in Kerala introduced focus groups to assess teachers' experiences with integrating technology into classrooms. Feedback led to specialised training programs, resulting in:

items: 30% improvement in teacher satisfaction scores.
18% increase in student performance.

description: A Harvard University study found that 94% of effective teaching practices are captured through regular classroom observations. Schools using these practices report:

items: 10-15% increase in student engagement.
Research by Stanford University's Graduate School of Education shows effective management reduces disruptive behaviour by 21%.
Teachers who vary their instructional strategies, such as group work or problem-solving, improve student engagement by 33%, according to research.
A 2023 McKinsey report revealed that 81% of teachers using technology in lessons report higher levels of student engagement and performance, especially with multimedia tools.
A Pune-based case study demonstrated that schools with a strong integration of child-centred learning saw a 25% increase in student participation and satisfaction.
